svg.text: The days of the week in Chinese follow the simple pattern:
only day of the week that does not follow this pattern.
(xīngqīrì) is used more often in writing, while
more often in conversation—but both words mean Sunday.
to ask questions about the day of the week.
What day of the week is it today?
她 星期天 去踢足球。
她 星期几 去踢足球？
She will go play soccer on Sunday.
Which day of the week will she go play soccer?
(rì) means “sun” or “day.” As a component, it is often
(but not always) found on the left side of the character.
(rì) in each character below? What do you notice about the
